xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: This work was supported by the Brazilian agencies CAPES, CNPq, and FAPEMIG. Diana. S. Albán Peñafiel thanks the SENESCYT of Equator, for their support in letting her continue her studies in Brazil.

head.citation-title: External hybrid force/pose controller for manipulator robots using dual quaternion algebra
head.abstracts: © 2017 IEEE.This paper presents an external hybrid force/pose controller for a robotic manipulator using a cascade scheme with two control loops. In the outer loop there is a force controller that acts as a perturbation for the position reference, whose purpose is to regulate the force applied by the end-effector during the interaction; the inner loop, which is used to control the end-effector pose (i.e., position and orientation), uses both the signals generated by the outer loop and the desired end-effector pose. The controller design relies on the interaction of the end-effector with the environment by using only the robot kinematics. Both robot modeling and controller design are done by using dual quaternion algebra. Simulations on the V-REP platform are performed to verify the proposed scheme. The results show that the force is maintained constant while the trajectory tracking is achieved with a variation produced by the regulation of the desired interaction force in the outer loop.

In the outer loop there is a force controller that acts as a perturbation for the position reference, whose purpose is to regulate the force applied by the end-effector during the interaction; the inner loop, which is used to control the end-effector pose (i.e., position and orientation), uses both the signals generated by the outer loop and the desired end-effector pose. The results show that the force is maintained constant while the trajectory tracking is achieved with a variation produced by the regulation of the desired interaction force in the outer loop.
